commit_message:
Add notifications for trove.backup.* actions

Reasons:
 - Trove should emit notifications when resources are being used.

Changes:
 - added backup usage notifications:
  - trove.backup.create.start|end|error:
    - start|error emited by taskmanager;
    - end|error emited by conductor.
  - trove.backup.delete.start|end|error:
    - all messages are emited by taskmanager.
 - unit/int tests proposed.

Partially Implements: blueprint ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I8e7dbdb82e4a200f338c4273eeacbfc7d87c603f

subject: Get default configuration for version + flavor
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-13 03:39:25.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/configurations.py', 'troveclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Get default configuration for version + flavor

This patch allows users to get the default config on a datastore version
flavor so they can know what the defaults are when creating a config
group that is not attached to an instance. This will help give a clear
description of what the config values are before making "custom" changes
to the config group.

Changes:
 - The configuration-default command now behaves as described above
 - The new configuration-default-instance command gets the default
   configuration from a given instance

Change-Id: Ic207e3878250756c36264090602f868090c6da72
DocImpact: Changes to command-line functionality as described above
Implements: blueprint default-config-values-for-datastore-version-flavor
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Get default configuration for version + flavor

This patch allows users to get the default config on a datastore version
flavor so they can know what the defaults are when creating a config
group that is not attached to an instance. This will help give a clear
description of what the config values are before making "custom" changes
to the config group.

Changes:
 - The configuration-default command now behaves as described above
 - The new configuration-default-instance command gets the default
   configuration from a given instance

Change-Id: Ic207e3878250756c36264090602f868090c6da72
DocImpact: Changes to command-line functionality as described above
Implements: blueprint default-config-values-for-datastore-version-flavor

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-22 14:54:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implements: bugfix BUGFIX
Closes-Bug: 1291111
The installation will be failure if the network proxy is set.
The reason of the failure is that any REST request sent to the
installed OpenStack itself will be redirected to the proxy server.
By default, the no_proxy is set to localhost only, which needs
to be reset to the localhost + HOST_IP + FLOATING_RANG + FIXED_RANGE.

Change-Id: Iccc4354d8eae0256acd63a5f12232d50d1ec4049

Author: Zu Qiang
Date: Thu May 22 11:35:00 2014 -0500

Implements: bugfix BUGFIX
Closes-Bug: 1322200/1291111

Reason of the change: The installation will be failure if the network proxy is set. The reason of the failure is that any REST request sent to the
installed OpenStack itself will be redirected to the proxy server. By default, the no_proxy is set to localhost only, which needs to be reset to the localhost + HOST_IP + FLOATING_RANG + FIXED_RANGE.

Note: This fix works with another fix in Devstack (change-Id Change-Id: I6b8e2ba2b7e78fa280283d5ee82d618d4f44ec5a)

Changes:
 Add "export USERHOME=$HOME" in redstack
 Add "Reset no proxy" in redstack

Change-Id: Iccc4354d8eae0256acd63a5f12232d50d1ec4049

Reason of the change: The installation will be failure if the network proxy is set. The reason of the failure is that any REST request sent to the

commit: Iccc4354d8eae0256acd63a5f12232d50d1ec4049
Date: Tue May 28 09:06:00 2014 -0500
Implements: bugfix BUGFIX
Closes-Bug: 1322200/1291111
Reason of the change:
When the Openstack is installed with a network proxy,
the installation will be failure. The reason is that any REST request
sent to Keystone will be redirected to the proxy server. By default,
the no_proxy is set to localhost only. The OpenStack address is not
added in the no_proxy parameter.

(Change-Id: I3cdace056b74fec111d24d222a886716a063d340)

 Add "export USERHOME=$HOME" in redstack. This is used by devstack
installation to save the new no_proxy in the home direction

commit_message:
Reset the no_proxy when the node is installed behind a proxy

commit: Iccc4354d8eae0256acd63a5f12232d50d1ec4049
Date: Tue May 28 09:06:00 2014 -0500
Implements: bugfix BUGFIX
Closes-Bug: 1322200/1291111
Reason of the change:
When the Openstack is installed with a network proxy,
the installation will be failure. The reason is that any REST request
sent to Keystone will be redirected to the proxy server. By default,
the no_proxy is set to localhost only. The OpenStack address is not
added in the no_proxy parameter.

Note: This fix works with another fix in Devstack
(Change-Id: I3cdace056b74fec111d24d222a886716a063d340)

Changes:
 Add "export USERHOME=$HOME" in redstack. This is used by devstack
installation to save the new no_proxy in the home direction

Change-Id: Iccc4354d8eae0256acd63a5f12232d50d1ec4049

Add v3 openstackclient CLI examples

Add some notes about authenticating with v3 keystone and
openstackclient. Also add some examples that don't exist in v2.0,
like domains and groups.

commit_message:
Change openstack to properly capitalized OpenStack

Incorrectly capitalized "openstack" strings from the notifier module
end up in generated parts of openstack-manuals.

This changeset syncs the module with oslo-incubator where the strings
have been fixed.

The command used was (cf. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo):

python update.py --nodeps --base trove --dest-dir ../trove --modules notifier

Change-Id: I9fafa9060261e674b0d7c027c8a7c81fda4b483e

commit_message:
Adds code to BaseInstance._delete_resources

Reasons:
- When a compute node has been deleted from nova with heat
  provisioning on, then on deletion of trove instance, it calls
  BaseInstance.delete_async with FreshInstance context which in-turn
  calls BaseInstance._delete_resources, which does nothing,
  for this reason, it results in  ghosted heat stacks.

Changes:
- Create a method _delete_heat_stack to remove heat stack, and called
  this method at both places in BaseInstance._delete_resources and
  BuiltInstanceTasks._delete_resources.
- Adds conditional stack deletion to BaseInstance._delete_resources,
  which deletes heat stack, if we have one which has got its compute
  node deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1269013
Change-Id: I300a77b16fc574844b301f05b951014e226e1ee9

commit_message:
Fixes trove show output

Reasons:
- When using trove show with instance-name as input, then output shows
  all unwanted information as described in bug, like flavor details
  and volume as a dict.

Changes:
- Moved the configuration attribute setting to top before setting up
  any other attribute.

Change-Id: I8d312e4210758e4d035dbac92c8e4f5bb793fa2f
Closes-Bug: #1322822

commit_message:
Use timeutils from oslo.utils

Rather than sync'ing with oslo-incubator, let's use the library
oslo.utils instead.
We can't remove timeutils under openstack_dashboard/openstack/common/
because it's still used by other common functions.
Let's take care of the final code clean in the last patch after
all code references has been updated.

Change-Id: I6e49eef320dd745bfaa00223e3f48077bcc5dc2c
Partially-Implements: blueprint improve-oslo-usage

Use strutils from oslo.utils

Rather than sync'ing with oslo-incubator, let's use the library
oslo.utils instead.

Change-Id: I6577cf53fb962c149e0c7bb2910c9d9a77f15356

subject: Allow --domain to be used for identity commands without lookup
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-07 23:35:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow --domain to be used for user/group list commands without list_domains

Performing a 'user list' or 'group list' command with the --domain option
attempts to look up the domain for name to ID conversion.  In the case of
an environment usng Keystone domains, it is desired to allow a domain admin
list users in their domains without allowing them to list or show domains.
The current behavior prevents the domain admin from listing user/group
objects since they will be forbidden to perform the underlying list_domains
operation.

This patch makes the a domain lookup error a soft failure, and falls back
to using the passed in domain argument directly as a domain ID in the list
request that it sends to Keystone.

Change-Id: I5139097f8cedc53693f6f71297518917ac72e50a

commit_message:
Allow --domain to be used for identity commands without lookup

Performing create, list, or set operations for users, groups, and projects
with the --domain option attempts to look up the domain for name to ID
conversion.  In the case of an environment using Keystone domains, it is
desired to allow a domain admin to perform these operations for objects in
their domain without allowing them to list or show domains. The current
behavior prevents the domain admin from performing these operations since
they will be forbidden to perform the underlying list_domains operation.

This patch makes the domain lookup error a soft failure, and falls back
to using the passed in domain argument directly as a domain ID in the
request that it sends to Keystone.

Change-Id: I5139097f8cedc53693f6f71297518917ac72e50a
Closes-Bug: #1378565

commit_message:
Add domain parameters to user show for Identity V3

Update `user show` for Identity V3 to account for a domain argument,
in doing so, also update `find resource` to be more flexible by
allowing **kwargs.
Also update `group show` and `project show` since they follow the
same logic as a user within a group.

Change-Id: Ib828e4dbeb0bd31164396069ce8a64c873179779
Closes-Bug: #1378165

commit_message:
convert restart_required to 'true' or 'false' string

The output of the configuration-parameters-list/show was
inadvertently changed when the parameters were moved into
the database in Juno.

Change-Id: Ic7d215482f5a9ab8ba2059cae7b91a99b35f2795

commit_message:
Fix pci_request_id break the upgrade from icehouse to juno

commit a8a5d44c8aca218f00649232c2b8a46aee59b77e add pci_request_id
as one item for the request_network tuple. But the icehouse code
assume only three items in the tuple.

This patch filters pci_request_id out from the tuple.

Change-Id: I991e1c68324fe92fac647583f3ec8f6aec637913
Closes-Bug: #1377447

commit_message:
Add a new section that lists implemented specs for middleware

Currently, we cannot differentiate between implemented and approved
specs for keystoneclient or keystonemiddleware. Created a directory
to move the completed specs to, and created a new section on the
landing page.

Change-Id: I8d36af36586cd6e42bd58a6b1ff5a9337d5728b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 16:18:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Split cliutils

Module cliutils should not have dependency to apiclient, so:
 - Exception apiclient.exceptions.MissingArgs is moved to cliutils
   (backport compatibility: alias is added to apiclient.exception)
 - cliutils.find_resource is moved to new module apiclient.utils.

Change-Id: Ifee0cfd077b0cf53a47cbc9066990071d1e27292
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-10 19:06:04.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/apiclient/test_utils.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/utils.py', 'openstack/common/cliutils.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'tests/unit/test_cliutils.py'], 'message': 'Split cliutils

Module cliutils should not have dependency to apiclient, so:
 - Exception apiclient.exceptions.MissingArgs is moved to cliutils
 - cliutils.find_resource is moved to new module apiclient.utils.

Change-Id: Ifee0cfd077b0cf53a47cbc9066990071d1e27292
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Split cliutils

Module cliutils should not have dependency to apiclient, so:
 - Exception apiclient.exceptions.MissingArgs is moved to cliutils
 - cliutils.find_resource is moved to new module apiclient.utils.

Change-Id: Ifee0cfd077b0cf53a47cbc9066990071d1e27292

commit_message:
Add the start message for debugging net info

When a network scenario test fails due to networking timeout, we can
get both server console log and network information for debugging.
Current network information doesn't contain the start message and
it seems a little confusion where starts network info.
This patch adds the message.

Change-Id: I8490c08b7073302d299f7b63dd9d6380d8a8d27e
Related-Bug: #1323658

commit_message:
Allow javelin to run with incomplete resources.yaml

Make it possible to run javelin without all possible keys in
resources.yaml by starting RES out as a defaultdict(list).

Closes-Bug: #1376185
Change-Id: I78520fff501ce0716e5c7c07b435735aa08305d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-03 17:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', 'Modulefile'], 'message': 'Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated). This patch
convert the Modulefile to metadata.json. (And use the common template
accross stackforge modules).

Change-Id: I07775e7b97202be627aeb364695c8c525856f54d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated). This patch
convert the Modulefile to metadata.json. (And use the common template
accross stackforge modules).

Change-Id: I07775e7b97202be627aeb364695c8c525856f54d

commit_message:
Modifying assertEquals call for Python 3 Compatibility

assertEquals() has been deprecated in favor of assertEqual() in Python 3.
Updating all calls to ensure compatibility.

Change-Id: Id9428d695d8e44122b9787b0313a394a7233d87d

Enable H904 PEP8 check

Fixes all files with the PEP8 error:

   H904  Wrap long lines in parentheses instead of a backslash

and enables the PEP8 check in tox.ini.

commit_message:
Allow backup operation in paused and suspend state

Snapshot operation allows paused and suspend instance to be
executed, this also should be applied to backup operation.

subject: Don't log every (friggin) migration version step during unit tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 16:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py'], 'message': "Don't log every (friggin) migration version step during unit tests

Right now any test that fails spews *all* of the migration steps at INFO
level along with the test output (assuming it did migrations). This patch
squelches the INFO-level messages from migrate, which don't add anything
useful anyway. Messages look like this:

    ...
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,967 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] 264 -> 265...
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,984 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] done
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,984 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] 265 -> 266...
    2014-10-10 09:51:42,003 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] done

Change-Id: I424bbb25c04b5e327c6d5d2ff8bad266bc7d51d0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't log every (friggin) migration version step during unit tests

Right now any test that fails spews *all* of the migration steps at INFO
level along with the test output (assuming it did migrations). This patch
squelches the INFO-level messages from migrate, which don't add anything
useful anyway. Messages look like this:

    ...
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,967 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] 264 -> 265...
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,984 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] done
    2014-10-10 09:51:41,984 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] 265 -> 266...
    2014-10-10 09:51:42,003 INFO [migrate.versioning.api] done

Change-Id: I424bbb25c04b5e327c6d5d2ff8bad266bc7d51d0

commit_message:
Fix verify_tempest_config with disabled services

The script silently fails when verifying API versions for services
that are not deployed or configured in the catalog.  This fixes it
by only verifying versions for services that actually exist in
keystone.

commit_message:
Fixes image create utf-8 multibyte test

Fixes test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name
so that it actually sends a UTF-8 multibyte character rather
than unicode. Also changes it to a 3 byte multibyte character
rather than a 4 byte multibyte character because glance currently
doesn't handle 4 byte utf-8 and will 500.

Change-Id: I064b563024a090899a4adcbbd462a18c5450830c
Related-Bug: 1006725

When testing against the v3 identity API, the create_user function
definition doesn't sync up to how it's being called. The result is
errors about mismatches in the number of arguments.

This patch updates the function to sync up with how it's being
called, which is also how the definition is written for the v2 API.

commit_message:
Fix create_user parameters for v3

When testing against the v3 identity API, the create_user function
definition doesn't sync up to how it's being called. The result is
errors about mismatches in the number of arguments.

This patch updates the function to sync up with how it's being
called, which is also how the definition is written for the v2 API.

Change-Id: I7fd68e774e54933e49b98b9690d803475fcb5d62
Closes-Bug: #1376830

commit_message:
grep check of "cinder type-list" should look for an exact match

thus avoiding the bug where a substring match could lead to a false
positive.

Change-Id: I545d93bd3f3b58a77438519b54cbbbd3bc80cff3

subject: Tweaked API layer of policy engine simulate
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 17:29:34.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/policy_model.py'], 'message': 'Tweaked API layer of policy engine simulate

Previously, if the 'delta' parameter was passed it would be
considered True, even if 'delta' was assigned the value 'False'.

This change makes the 'delta' parameter True only if it has
a value assigned and it is something we can reasonably expect
to indicate true, e.g. "True", 1, or "1".

Change-Id: I35e60eefae0f4719b720b09a23a57e2be986e272
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tweaked API layer of policy engine simulate

Previously, if the 'delta' parameter was passed it would be
considered True, even if 'delta' was assigned the value 'False'.

This change makes the 'delta' parameter True only if it has
a value assigned and it is something we can reasonably expect
to indicate true, e.g. "True", 1, or "1".

Change-Id: I35e60eefae0f4719b720b09a23a57e2be986e272

commit_message:
Separate ALLOWED_HOSTS and ServerAlias configuration

In some cases it is required to be possible to have different values
of parameter ALLOWED_HOSTS in settings_local.py and ServerAlias directives
in vhost.conf. This patch separated parameter $fqdn to two new parameters:
$allowed_hosts and $server_aliases.

Change-Id: I431ec01dd32e5e7c460251502dbd1c1b03ec2fe7
(cherry picked from commit 16b482ea21a70d8dd06ab4c98ac5a218399b0213)

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-13 07:24:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
Eseries warn if multipath is not set for img xfer

Warn at driver startup if the configuration option
"use_multipath_for_image_xfer" has not been set to "True".  Eseries filers
require appropriate multipath/DMMP configuration on the host running the
cinder volume process for image transfers to work reliably.

Change-Id: Ib79a23a5a9527b254f155a9f4ea022d4387a4a13
Closes-Bug: #1376349

commit_message:
Do not rely on hash ordering in tests

With tox 1.7.2 hash randomization will be on by default, causing
random failures of our tests. How to reproduce:
* Update tox
* Run something like:
  $ for i in {1..20}; do tox -epy27 || break; done

Closes-bug: #1348818
(cherry picked from commit b056fca27897947ce5ef1326ee19db767f14f0ae)

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/api/v1/test_drivers.py

NOTE(adam_g):  The following changes had to be tacked on here to get
through the stable/icehouse gate:

    * .testr.conf is also updated to exclude the in-tree Nova
       driver tests, which were never run until Juno and are
       breaking test runs for stable/icehouse.

    * tox.ini is updated to specify PYTHONHASHSEED=0 for doc builds,
      backported from 2abea080f617928af6386074e121aba33db2fe33.

Change-Id: I52c10c47a7a1c0e6a9e436efb090bbcb0fb02edc

commit_message:
Add the PXE VendorPassthru interface to PXEDracDriver

Without the PXE VendorPassthru interface to expose the "pass_deploy_info"
method in the vendor_passthru endpoint of the API the DRAC it can't
continue the deployment after the ramdisk is booted.

Closes-Bug: #1379705
Change-Id: I21042cbb95a486742abfcb430471d01cd73b3a4a

commit_message:
Make sure that the properties are stored on updates

Previously properties_data was only stored on creation, now
this is getting passed to the update mechanism too.
Later we can look at reworking this into a single mechanism.

Closes-bug: #1377681
Change-Id: If3d476f34b9e61a3c99f63ba33734a875353c8fc

subject: Ensure installation of iptables on openSUSE for nova-api
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 15:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_nova-controller-install.xml'], 'message': 'Ensure installation of iptables on openSUSE for nova-api

On a really minimal openSUSE installation iptables is not installed. Because
nova-api requires iptables-save and iptables-save is part of the iptables
package we should ensure the installation of iptables.

Change-Id: I9ac5a7006b77542abb155de55876e0518fdfc37a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure installation of iptables on openSUSE for nova-api

On a really minimal openSUSE installation iptables is not installed. Because
nova-api requires iptables-save and iptables-save is part of the iptables
package we should ensure the installation of iptables.

Change-Id: I9ac5a7006b77542abb155de55876e0518fdfc37a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 15:40:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Libvirt Watchdog support

Using the flavor extra_specs property "hw_watchdog_action" was broken.
Scheduling of a new instance always failed with NoValidHostFound error
because of ComputeCapabilitiesFilter. In this patch was added
scope 'driver' to this property.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1367344

Change-Id: Ic5344ec34a130ee5a0ed2c7348af0b9d79e3508e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-25 23:28:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix libvirt watchdog support

Using the flavor extra_specs property "hw_watchdog_action" was broken.
Scheduling of a new instance always failed with NoValidHostFound error
because of ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, which treated this property as a host capability to be checked.

To fix this hw_watchdog_action property is put into 'driver:' scope, so that it will be ignored by ComputeCapabilitiesFilter in scheduler and handled in libvirt driver. The doc must be fixed accordingly.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1367344

Change-Id: Ic5344ec34a130ee5a0ed2c7348af0b9d79e3508e
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-09-25 23:29:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix libvirt watchdog support

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2014-10-08 07:00:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix libvirt watchdog support

Using the flavor extra_specs property "hw_watchdog_action" was broken.
Scheduling of a new instance always failed with NoValidHostFound error
because of ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, which treated this property as a

To fix this hw_watchdog_action property is put into 'driver:' scope, so
that it will be ignored by ComputeCapabilitiesFilter in scheduler and
handled in libvirt driver. The doc must be fixed accordingly.

Now driver accepts both 'hw_watchdog_action' and
'driver:hw_watchdog_action', tests were edited for these cases.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Fix libvirt watchdog support

Using the flavor extra_specs property "hw_watchdog_action" was broken.
Scheduling of a new instance always failed with NoValidHostFound error
because of ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, which treated this property as a
host capability to be checked.

Commit f0ff4d51057080e769407e873e5ed212f15b773d caused the problem.

To fix this watchdog_action property is put into 'hw:' scope, so
that it will be ignored by ComputeCapabilitiesFilter in scheduler and
handled in libvirt driver. The doc must be fixed accordingly.

Now driver accepts both 'hw_watchdog_action' and
'hw:watchdog_action', tests were edited for these cases.
Were added TODO items to delete the compat code in the next release.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1367344

Change-Id: Ic5344ec34a130ee5a0ed2c7348af0b9d79e3508e

commit_message:
Make clear in docs to use _LE() when using LOG.exception()

Added note to guidelines.rst about this case and added an example
in usage.rst.

Closes-Bug: #1378053

commit_message:
Remove compiled message catalogs

A kind of binary files are useless to be maintained in git repo.
I18N team and package distributors have agreed to remove compiled
message catalogs from Horizon git repository.

The instruction on how to compile message catalogs will be
covered by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/126169/
or the installation guide.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I81b05cf79c21d85bed8a6da6df659955e7ac58c5
Closes-Bug: #1196982

This revises the servers, images, and flavors schemas to avoid a
duplicate definition of the top-level tags in those schemas.  Instead,
of defines each schema to allow either a list of tags with only
name/id (as in the index listings), or a list of fully-defined
servers/images/flavors.  It is not permitted to mix and match.

It also adds three kinds of unit tests for the API schemas:

* A basic check to ensure that the schema files are valid RelaxNG;
* A check to ensure that the collected body of schema files does not
  contain duplicate top-level tag definitions;
* Explicit test XML documents.

commit_message:
Revise compute API schemas and add tests

This revises the servers, images, and flavors schemas to avoid a
duplicate definition of the top-level tags in those schemas.  Instead,
of defines each schema to allow either a list of tags with only
name/id (as in the index listings), or a list of fully-defined
servers/images/flavors.  It is not permitted to mix and match.

It also adds three kinds of unit tests for the API schemas:

* A basic check to ensure that the schema files are valid RelaxNG;
* A check to ensure that the collected body of schema files does not
  contain duplicate top-level tag definitions;
* Explicit test XML documents.

Closes-Bug: 885025
Change-Id: I542b420de34fd82bb2a2813f36637aef2c2d5c92

commit_message:
Add database relationship between router and ports

Add an explicit schema relationship between a router and its ports. This
change ensures referential integrity among the entities and prevents orphaned
ports.

Change-Id: I09e8a694cdff7f64a642a39b45cbd12422132806
Closes-Bug: #1378866
(cherry picked from commit 93012915a3445a8ac8a0b30b702df30febbbb728)

commit_message:
Support for languagepack build command

This patch is related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125731/

This change allows an end user to pass in a languagepack
metadata file while building a custom languagepack. The
final glance image created will be tagged with this data.

Change-Id: I20b52fd9436b7c89bc3001a06e51a804678943e0

commit_message:
Create role and domain setup for heat template defined users

To setup heat for template defined users, several identity registration
steps need to happen.  The first is creating the role for it.
This can be done with the current identity registration provider.
The next three steps (doc in the code as todo) deal with the domain and
requires keystone v3 (bug-1267137). These are handled by a script shipped
with heat, heat-keystone-setup-domain.

Change-Id: I74154ccae609526ec92b916bac4ff8bc60aed170
Related-Bug: #1369654

commit_message:
Separate endpoints for vncserver_listen and vncserver_proxyclient_address

* A patch for Common added a new endpoint for vnc proxy
* Use the new vnc proxy endpoint for the nova.conf

Closes-Bug: #1367807

commit_message:
Set volume_driver for iscsi backend explicitly

Setting the volume_driver option explicitly even for iscsi backend is
desirable, because if the user would switch from e.g. an nfs backend
to iscsi, the volume_driver config option would not be changed during
the Puppet run and still point to the nfs driver.

Defaults to LVMISCSIDriver, can be overriden to LVMISERDriver.

Change-Id: I860508ff92fce4add21c50e684e1717fc4f16622

commit_message:
Run syntax check for OCF scripts

Make fuel_syntax_check.sh script run syntax check for any file
found under "files/ocf/" subfolder in all puppet modules.

Also bugfix for "rake spec" testing part of the script.

Change-Id: I83c5bb1366b9284ff411c3e3e54e3a27c4049815
Closes-bug: 1376254
Closes-bug: 1378857
DocImpact

commit_message:
VMWare: Fix nova-compute crash when instance datastore not available

During nova-compute service startup, init_host will try to get_info for
instances. If datastore of certain instances become not reachable, some
VM properties like 'summary.config.memorySizeMB' will not be available.
This will cause nova-compute process exit with error.

Change-Id: I6753ce5658b629c216ebfbaab610c8fd0755466a
Closes-Bug: #1337236

commit_message:
Do not attempt a stack update when it is deleting

If a stack is in any delete state(inprogress, failed),
don't attempt to update it.

Closes-bug: #1379113
Change-Id: I1de99702a385ac8ddeffc568270d2d3b51674323

commit_message:
Prevent setting swift+config locations

Forbid setting 'swift+config' locations in a similar
manner to 'file' for security reasons; knowledge of
the reference name should not be exploitable.

Setting swift+config had been prevented when swift
was the default store, this patch changes to forbid
setting no matter which store is the default.

As with change id I75af34145521f533dcd6f5fd7690f5a68f3b44b3
this is v1 only for now.

Change-Id: I62c4980bd5c2f3dd77fc40cd007bc1067eca63a4
Closes-bug: 1334196

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 09:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': "Document token hash algorithm option

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116509/ ,
django-openstack-auth will support a new option for the token hash
algorithm. This adds the documentation to Horizon's local settings
example file.

This is for security hardening. The token hash algorithm defaults
to MD5, which is considered too weak due to the potential for hash
collisions. Some security standards require a SHA2 hash algorithm to
be used.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I6774b9b7215d191259586e4721e357487bb777cd
Closes-Bug: #1174499
(cherry picked from commit 372d033d89c0f5d305959a6ad5fd3e1159cc91ed)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Document token hash algorithm option

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116509/ ,
django-openstack-auth will support a new option for the token hash
algorithm. This adds the documentation to Horizon's local settings
example file.

This is for security hardening. The token hash algorithm defaults
to MD5, which is considered too weak due to the potential for hash
collisions. Some security standards require a SHA2 hash algorithm to
be used.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I6774b9b7215d191259586e4721e357487bb777cd
Closes-Bug: #1174499
(cherry picked from commit 372d033d89c0f5d305959a6ad5fd3e1159cc91ed)

commit_message:
Handle error in templates with incorrect resources

This patch adds additional validation resources section for hot templates,
it allows determine of the real problem in template and give the user an
adequate message.

Change-Id: Iff5e1b541b00a82dfce524f00ff1d20f50ae92da
Closes-Bug: #1365949

commit_message:
Don't evaluate ceilometer watchrules

If you have both Ceilometer and cwlite alarms in one stack (a little odd)
we try to evaluate Ceilometer alarms in the periodic task.

Change-Id: Ia75bf1e5cfa3e2ac31242eafd5fa96d757786ada
Closes-bug: #1375111

commit_message:
Insist on kernel 3.2.0-69 for precise

Kernel 3.2.0-70 breaks openvswitch compilation on precise,
this removes -70 and reinstalls -69 so that it continues
working. Ubuntu bug is at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openvswitch/+bug/1379201

Change-Id: I3f854cc662652606669920367b4ff4cc4d545f88

commit_message:
Add a new PowerDNS backend based on MiniDNS

This is stage one of phasing out the old PowerDNS driver, as we move
through the Kilo cycle and mDNS/pools become reality, the original driver
can be removed.

Implements-Blueprint: transition-powerdns-to-mdns
Change-Id: I7a3aa0a894e2c0a4fa565e8d58cccba3644e0cac

subject: Use ntp.service instead of ntpd.service to start NTP services on openSUSE
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 10:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_basics-ntp.xml'], 'message': 'Use ntp.service instead of ntpd.service to start NTP services on openSUSE

systemctl enable ntpd.service is not working on openSUSE 13.1:

---snip---
% sudo systemctl enable ntpd.service
Failed to issue method call: No such file or directory
---snap---

systemctl enable ntp.service is working on openSUSE 13.1:

---snip---
% sudo systemctl enable ntp.service
ntp.service is not a native service, redirecting to /sbin/chkconfig.
[...]
---snap---

Change-Id: I1979f08786bc1ea67c011415368bf57b35e11dd7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use ntp.service instead of ntpd.service to start NTP services on openSUSE

systemctl enable ntpd.service is not working on openSUSE 13.1:

---snip---
% sudo systemctl enable ntpd.service
Failed to issue method call: No such file or directory
---snap---

systemctl enable ntp.service is working on openSUSE 13.1:

---snip---
% sudo systemctl enable ntp.service
ntp.service is not a native service, redirecting to /sbin/chkconfig.
[...]
---snap---

Change-Id: I1979f08786bc1ea67c011415368bf57b35e11dd7

hot-guide software configuration

This change completes the first two sections of the
software deployment chapter of the hot guide. This change covers
image building and boot config, the next change in the series
covers the software deployment resource.

commit_message:
Drop xmlutils

It appears that the security issues that this module tried to patch are
now fixed in better way upstream. Let's drop it.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/047368.html for details.

Change-Id: I28109a57de48406ef163bf64b9e0d2d3feaf2bcd

commit_message:
Enable Neutron DVR support in TripleO installation.

To enable Neutron DVR support, this change splits out the l3-agent and
metadata-agent elements to the newly created 'neutron-router' image element.
Additionally, the neutron configuration files neutron.conf, l3_agent.ini
and plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini files are modified to support additional
Neutron DVR parameters (if set).

Change-Id: Ibadeefd920daab59b1e3de0d2266fd9705ff6731
blueprint: support-neutron-dvr

commit_message:
Fix signature validation failure when using qpid message queue

When using qpid message queue, the metering message will get
signature validation failure because of extra unicode encoding
given by json loads. This change peels off unicode of the message
so that this issue can be avoided.

Change-Id: Ia23af789460ad8597867902f713b8a78f4a09e06
Closes-Bug: 1373356

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-02 22:00:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor _process_routers to handle a single router

The method _process_routers no longer handles multiple routers.  The
only caller of this method would construct a list of exactly one
router in order to make the call.  This made the for loop unnecessary.
The method's logic is too heavy for its current purpose.  This commit
removes much of the weight.

The use of the sets in this method is also no longer necessary.  It
became clear that all of it boiled down to "if the router is not
compatible with with this agent but it is known in router_info from
before then we need to remove it."  This is an exceptional condition
that shouldn't be handled in this method so I raise an exception and
handle it in process_router_update where other router removal is
handled.  Logging was added for this exceptional condition.

The eventlet pool was also obsolete.  It was used to spawn two methods
and there was a waitall at the end.  The other refactoring made it
clear that the two spawns were mutually exclusive.  There was only one
thread spawned for any given invocation of the method and the eventlet
pool is overkill.

Change-Id: Ibeac591b08565d10b2a9730e25a54f2cd11fc2bc
Partially-Implements: bp restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
Refactor _process_routers to handle a single router

The method _process_routers no longer handles multiple routers.  The
only caller of this method would construct a list of exactly one
router in order to make the call.  This made the for loop unnecessary.
The method's logic is too heavy for its current purpose.  This commit
removes much of the weight.

The use of the sets in this method is also no longer necessary.  It
became clear that all of it boiled down to "if the router is not
compatible with with this agent but it is known in router_info from
before then we need to remove it."  This is an exceptional condition
that shouldn't be handled in this method so I raise an exception and
handle it in process_router_update where other router removal is
handled.  Logging was added for this exceptional condition.

The eventlet pool was also obsolete.  It was used to spawn two methods
and there was a waitall at the end.  The other refactoring made it
clear that the two spawns were mutually exclusive.  There was only one
thread spawned for any given invocation of the method and the eventlet
pool is overkill.

Change-Id: Ibeac591b08565d10b2a9730e25a54f2cd11fc2bc
Closes-Bug: #1378398

Closes-Bug: #1071799

commit_message:
Report permission denied when parsing config

Previously was returning ConfigFilesNotFoundError, when
underlying error was 13 - Permission Denied

Change-Id: I2c418f023c510205aa12a3acb9b09e6b1681f0d4
Closes-Bug: #1071799

[{'created': '2014-08-12 15:31:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support message queue clusters in inter-cell communication

Since cells use oslo.messaging to specify and store the message queue URL,
multiple hosts can be specified by manually modifying that URL in the database.
However, there is no way to specify multiple hosts during cell creation phase.
This patch adds a --broker-hosts option to `nova-manage cell create` command,
which is analogous to the rabbit_hosts option in nova.conf and can be used to
specify multiple message queue servers as a comma separated list. Each server
is specified using hostname:port with both being mandatory. The existing
--hostname and --port options continue to remain but are only considered if no
--broker-hosts is specified.
Internally, each host is converted to a oslo.messaging.TransportHost
and added to the generated TransportURL.
This patch also adds unit tests for creation of the TransportHosts from
user given input.

commit_message:
Support message queue clusters in inter-cell communication

Since cells use oslo.messaging to specify and store the message queue URL,
multiple hosts can be specified by manually modifying that URL in the database.
However, there is no way to specify multiple hosts during cell creation phase.
This patch adds a --broker_hosts option to `nova-manage cell create` command,
which is analogous to the rabbit_hosts option in nova.conf and can be used to
specify multiple message queue servers as a comma separated list. Each server
is specified using hostname:port with both being mandatory. The existing
--hostname and --port options continue to remain but are only considered if no
--broker_hosts is specified.
Internally, each host is converted to a oslo.messaging.TransportHost
and added to the generated TransportURL.
This patch also adds unit tests for creation of the TransportHosts from
user given input.

Change-Id: I14de860b1d12f3e2c0169b58651d580792d6ce0e
Closes-Bug: 1178541

commit_message:
Remove capacity/csv from public URLs

With the new cookie-based authentication this download link does
not need anymore to be publicly accessible (the X-Auth-Token header
was the reason to first make the link public).

Change-Id: If72bb8fe764810c565fc08f960db3e19ddaf4fb9
Closes-Bug: #1362615
Related-Bug: #1379000
(cherry picked from commit 7bd6b11e6808eebdcb12310c3a13d2e9583a8f44)

commit_message:
Bring back X-Auth-Token by default

It seems that requests are made to other places than API so this
token is still required there (Health check for example with OSTF).

Change-Id: I2f0e47a57b360abd04f2ca21fc013ccd34d84eec
Closes-Bug: #1379000
(cherry picked from commit 207580c58842166ef516b36e5917be251b7472ec)

subject: Add cookie-based authentication along with X-Auth-Token
revisions:

commit_message:
Add cookie-based authentication along with X-Auth-Token

- added jquery.cookie as Bower dependency
- fixed keystone.py middleware to process the cookie and inject X-Auth-Token
  into the request, X-Auth-Token still has priority though
- fixed 401 response format to return iterable (list)
- added test_auth_token for testing both authentication methods

(cherry picked from commit 9a8d01ff1ac54bb9c3c737bdb9ff5c0a688f3013)

Conflicts:
	nailgun/bower.json
	nailgun/static/js/main.js

Change-Id: I01239c93b8f0d5da95424d44c96f6fb60ab378fd
Implements: blueprint access-control-master-node-improvments

commit_message:
Migration to oslo.serialization

oslo.serialization library has graduated and now provides
all the jsonutils API that was available in oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: Ie80d58db4a96a10a57f975984fe69dead95c6d63

commit_message:
Refreshed translations

Updated translations by running the following:
$ python setup.py extract_messages
$ python setup.py update_catalog --no-fuzzy-matching \
  --ignore-obsolete=true
$ source \
  ../infra/project-config/jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh
$ setup_loglevel_vars
$ cleanup_po_files trove

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent behaviour exceeding quota limit

Added quota checks for security groups, networks and routers. If quotas are
exceeded then buttons to create are disabled and feedback is given to the
user.

Appropriate tests are also in place

Change-Id: Ie49db5397d87a0c9a583b64e5de34460144b5956
Closes-bug: 1278449

subject: Update references to auth_token middleware
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 08:55:02.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/common/auth_url.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_ec2token.py', 'contrib/heat_keystoneclient_v2/heat_keystoneclient_v2/client.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'contrib/heat_keystoneclient_v2/heat_keystoneclient_v2/tests/test_client.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py', 'heat/api/aws/ec2token.py'], 'message': "Update references to auth_token middleware

There's references to the auth_token middleware in keystoncelient.
The auth_token middleware has been moved to keystonemiddleware and
the version in keystoneclient shouldn't be used anymore.

If these references aren't updated, then when options are changed in
keystonemiddleware.auth_token the heat-api will fail to start because
there's duplicate options in keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token.

Change-Id: I04573aa5ff967afe3e00329f797fcc71b779e7b3
Closes-Bug: #1379082
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update references to auth_token middleware

There's references to the auth_token middleware in keystoncelient.
The auth_token middleware has been moved to keystonemiddleware and
the version in keystoneclient shouldn't be used anymore.

If these references aren't updated, then when options are changed in
keystonemiddleware.auth_token the heat-api will fail to start because
there's duplicate options in keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token.

Change-Id: I04573aa5ff967afe3e00329f797fcc71b779e7b3
Closes-Bug: #1379082

commit_message:
Remove capacity/csv from public URLs

With the new cookie-based authentication this download link does
not need anymore to be publicly accessible (the X-Auth-Token header
was the reason to first make the link public).

Change-Id: If72bb8fe764810c565fc08f960db3e19ddaf4fb9
Closes-Bug: #1362615
Related-Bug: #1379000

commit_message:
Add role assignment notifications for identity

Keystone added CADF notifications for role assignments in Juno.
We should be able to meter these events from Ceilometer.

Spec is here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/juno/role-assignment-notifications.html

Impl is here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/112204/ (merged)

commit_message:
clean capabilities

this patch removes the event capability from meter db as all event
driver code has been moved out of meter db and into event db tree.

Change-Id: I08ff7e74161ff48bbb8d5288d27677b7f3dfbcdb
Implements: blueprint dedicated-event-db

commit_message:
Update devstack config

Fix typos in local.conf
Add heat_stack_owner role to ci user
Fix ubuntu cloud image URL
Add Fedora 20 cloud image
Add workaround against https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1263997
Use default security group from CI tenant
Typo
Update user quotas
Code style and readability
Post unstack script
Post stack script
Add build script for image with Murano agent
Add Readme
Fix metadata issue (add use_forwarder_for)
Update split-logs.sh to support devstack log files
Add script to rotate devstack logs
Update murano image build script
Add murano heartbeat jobs
Add kind of setup script
Add jenkins job templates
Add function to check that heat stacks are deleted after tests.
    If not - fail the job.
Add murano-devbox-devstack script - use it on CI mostly

Change-Id: I57a5566a14c66ec8e4378e3545344f0fb6a2617b

commit_message:
Sets default encoding for PostgreSQL testing

Fixes the issue of some tests failing when inserting unicode characters
in the PostgreSQL test suite. This patch sets the default encoding of
all created databases to UTF8.

Related to blueprint sql-unit-tests-on-real-backend

Change-Id: Ie8629dd655ddb2327cce13c7e2a31cdb011791b5

commit_message:
Add user_metadata to network samples

Previously 'user_metadata' is not included in ceilometer network samples,
while it is in other samples. This causes network samples not triggering
alarms heat created.

Change-Id: Iafb4c42955fceaaf20fef1f9580ddb1331a0c724
Closes-Bug: 1369500

[{'created': '2014-10-03 12:55:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "honour `replication_mode' configuration option in the VMware NSX plugin

- `replication_mode' stanza determines network traffic replication mode.
  Default value for this setting is `service' which means that NSX
  cluster operates with NSX Service nodes (as any NSX production cluster
  should) and packet replication on router and switches happens on NSX
  Service nodes.
- setting `replication_mode' to `source' means that traffic replication
  happens localy on nodes, which is the only option if we do not have

commit_message:
honour `replication_mode' configuration option in the VMware NSX plugin

- `replication_mode' stanza determines network traffic replication mode.
  Default value for this setting is `service' which means that NSX
  cluster operates with NSX Service nodes (as any NSX production cluster
  should) and packet replication on router and switches happens on NSX
  Service nodes.
- setting `replication_mode' to `source' means that traffic replication
  happens localy on nodes, which is the only option if we do not have
  Service nodes.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I830dc687dbf25a8fd9e4d375c5e37af2bda83df4
Partial-bug: #1365043

commit_message:
Rename glance index to glance image-list in tests

Glance index was deprecated in Icehouse and
obsoleted in Juno. The correct command is
"glance image-list". Tests are updated to
reflect this change.

blueprint fuel-deploy-juno

Change-Id: If6c03d0b794b978beb8b95983141c1cafe3c069a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 16:38:24.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_container_sync_realms.py'], 'message': 'Fix unit tests failing in some cases

TestZeroCopy used to fail when 'localhost' resolved to an ipv6
address. https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/8

Also, "test_container_sync_realms.py:TestUtils.test_os_error"
used to fail when unit tests were run as root user. This is
because despite os.chmod(), a root user still has permission
to access the file and hence OSError is not raised.

Change-Id: Ife80b203358557999734515261814ce76c0e00cd
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests failing in some cases

TestZeroCopy used to fail when 'localhost' resolved to an ipv6
address. https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/8

Also, "test_container_sync_realms.py:TestUtils.test_os_error"
used to fail when unit tests were run as root user. This is
because despite os.chmod(), a root user still has permission
to access the file and hence OSError is not raised.

Change-Id: Ife80b203358557999734515261814ce76c0e00cd
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable DIB service to build with minimal net access

Adds two new options to lib/dib that will help devstack slaves
use cached content and content local to cloud provides:

 * DIB_BUILD_OFFLINE: This will enable DIB to rely entirely on
   cached images without making any additional calls to cloud-images.ubuntu.com
   to validate hashes/freshness.

 * DIB_APT_SOURCES: Used to specify alternatve sources.list for image builds.
   Setting this enables the addition of the apt-sources element during image
   builds and is only supported for ubuntu/debian builds.

Change-Id: I9b9ca72ec551565d454610aacb86c585f0384f13
Partial-bug: #1375488

subject: Add new features to swift-drive-audit
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@hpe.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7134, 'name': 'Lorcan Browne', 'email': 'lorcan.browne@hp.com', 'username': 'brownelo'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-18 17:01:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new features to swift-drive-audit

This patch adds two new features to swift-drive-audit. The first
is an option in the drive-audit.conf file that allows the operator
to prevent the drives ever being unmounted automatically,
regardless of the amount of errors present. This could be of
benefit in very small systems consisting of only one or two drives
where the operator would like to manually unmount/fix the
particular drive(s) and minimise any potential downtime.

The second is another option in drive-audit.conf that allows the
operator to select a recon directory. This directory will then
have a drive.recon file which will keep an up-to-date record of
the swift drives and any errors associated with them. An example
of the output would be as follows:

{"/srv/node/disk2": "0", "/srv/node/disk3": "25", "/srv/node/disk0": "0",
"/srv/node/disk1": "0", "/srv/node/disk10": "0", "/srv/node/disk7": "0",
"/srv/node/disk4": "137", "/srv/node/disk5": "0", "/srv/node/disk8": "0",
"/srv/node/disk9": "0", "/srv/node/disk6": "0", "/srv/node/disk11": "60"}

This would allow the operator to monitor the errors on the swift
drives without having to spend time searching through logs. Also, if
this is accepted, it should be possible to add an option to
swift-recon that would keep track of this at a system level.

Change-Id: Ib5dacf8622b7363e070c274c7c30c8ead448a055
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-19 12:36:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new features to swift-drive-audit

is an option in the drive-audit.conf file that allows the operator
to prevent the drives ever being unmounted automatically,
regardless of the amount of errors present. This could be of
benefit in very small systems consisting of only one or two drives
where the operator would like to manually unmount/fix the
particular drive(s) and minimise any potential downtime.

The second is another option in drive-audit.conf that allows the
operator to select a recon directory. This directory will then
have a drive.recon file which will keep an up-to-date record of
the swift drives and any errors associated with them. An example
of the output would be as follows:

commit_message:
Add new features to swift-drive-audit

This patch adds two new features to swift-drive-audit. The first
is an option in the drive-audit.conf file that allows the operator
to prevent the drives ever being unmounted automatically,
regardless of the amount of errors present. This could be of
benefit in very small systems consisting of only one or two drives
where the operator would like to manually unmount/fix the
particular drive(s) and minimise any potential downtime.

The second is another option in drive-audit.conf that allows the
operator to select a recon directory. This directory will then
have a drive.recon file which will keep an up-to-date record of
the swift drives and any errors associated with them. An example
of the output would be as follows:

{"/srv/node/disk2": "0", "/srv/node/disk3": "25", "/srv/node/disk0": "0",
"/srv/node/disk1": "0", "/srv/node/disk10": "0", "/srv/node/disk7": "0",
"/srv/node/disk4": "137", "/srv/node/disk5": "0", "/srv/node/disk8": "0",
"/srv/node/disk9": "0", "/srv/node/disk6": "0", "/srv/node/disk11": "60"}

This would allow the operator to monitor the errors on the swift
drives without having to spend time searching through logs. Also, if
this is accepted, it should be possible to add an option to
swift-recon that would keep track of this at a system level.

Change-Id: Ib5dacf8622b7363e070c274c7c30c8ead448a055

commit_message:
Add simple task affinity feature

 * This works only if we want to receive msg on
   one of all tagged nodes.
 * We should set 'host' parameter in executor
   section of our config for correct task affinity
   work.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-task-executor-affinity

Change-Id: Ia7b529529695163ee1819fce47ac22fddce414fb

commit_message:
Create standard workflows and actions

 * Standard workflows are creating during sync_db.sh
 * Standard workflows include:
     - std.create_instance
     - std.delete_instance
     (list will be extended in future)
 * Standard actions:
     - std.wait_ssh (needed for std.create_instance)
 * Make it possible to see these workflows from any project (global scope)
 * Small changes in sqlalchemy api and workflows_service

Partially implements blueprint mistral-multitenancy

Change-Id: I8a8ace40949b2b711a292aac94d7e6354d1dff9c

subject: don't call client.authenticate() only when it is authenticated
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 02:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "remove redundant [keystone]client.authenticate()

Actually, that line is redundant and costly for not-so-big API. In
examples I tested:
                            before                after
keystone create user*       ~0.35s                ~0.22s
keystone create token       ~0.21s                ~0.13s

The data based on real enviornment, but this could explain the problem
here. That redundant line bring about 0.7s overload which is costly for
those APIs which could respond in 1 second.

A little more, removing this is not harmful. Let's see keystoneclient's
document:

>>> from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client
>>> keystone = client.Client(username=USERNAME, password=PASSWORD,
>>>                          tenant_name=TENANT, auth_url=AUTH_URL)
>>> keystone.tenants.list()

We could find that keystoneclient is designed for being used WITHOUT
that 'client.authenticate()' by default. At last, we could see those in
codes[1][2].

* this case is create token first and create user then which is two API
called
[1]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/client.py#L190-L191
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v2_0/client.py#L146-L147

Change-Id: Ib9d766a345b68b3920121d8b8c69c4f3c5ca1dc2
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-10 06:06:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[keystone]client.authenticate() only with endpoint, not auth_url

Actually, that line is redundant if call keystoneclient with auth_url
and without endpoint parameter, because in this case keystoneclient will
call authenticate itself[1][2]. Actually this case is managed by
'endpoint_type' now. So this patch changes the behavior to call
authenticate() only when the client is not authenticated. One of not
authenticated case is passing endpoint parameter into keystoneclient.

There are examples I tested:
                            before                after
keystone create user*       ~0.35s                ~0.22s
keystone create token       ~0.21s                ~0.13s

The data based on real enviornment, but could explain something still.
That redundant authenticate line bring about 0.07s overload which is costly
for those APIs which could respond in 1 second. In a case calling API with
500 times and 10 concurrency, I could find the whole scenario time would
reduced from 110s to 65s by removing that line.

* this case is to create token first and create user then which two API
are called
[1]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/client.py#L190-L191
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v2_0/client.py#L146-L147

Change-Id: Ib9d766a345b68b3920121d8b8c69c4f3c5ca1dc2
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-10-10 06:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['rally/osclients.py'], 'message': "don't call client.authenticate() only when it is authenticated

and without endpoint parameter, because in this case keystoneclient will
call authenticate itself[1][2]. Actually this case is managed by
'endpoint_type' now. So this patch changes the behavior to call
authenticate() only when the client is not authenticated. One of not
authenticated case is passing endpoint parameter into keystoneclient.

There are examples I tested:
                            before                after
keystone create user*       ~0.35s                ~0.22s
keystone create token       ~0.21s                ~0.13s

The data based on real enviornment, but could explain something still.
That redundant authenticate line bring about 0.07s overload which is costly
for those APIs which could respond in 1 second. In a case calling API with
500 times and 10 concurrency, I could find the whole scenario time would
reduced from 110s to 65s by removing that line.

* this case is to create token first and create user then which two API
are called

https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/client.py#L190-L191

Change-Id: Ib9d766a345b68b3920121d8b8c69c4f3c5ca1dc2
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
don't call client.authenticate() only when it is authenticated

Actually, that line is redundant if call keystoneclient with auth_url
and without endpoint parameter, because in this case keystoneclient will
call authenticate itself[1][2]. Actually this case is managed by
'endpoint_type' now. So this patch changes the behavior to call
authenticate() only when the client is not authenticated. One of not
authenticated case is passing endpoint parameter into keystoneclient.

There are examples I tested:
                            before                after
keystone create user*       ~0.35s                ~0.22s
keystone create token       ~0.21s                ~0.13s

The data based on real enviornment, but could explain something still.
That redundant authenticate line bring about 0.07s overload which is costly
for those APIs which could respond in 1 second. In a case calling API with
500 times and 10 concurrency, I could find the whole scenario time would
reduced from 110s to 65s by removing that line.

* this case is to create token first and create user then which two API
are called
[1]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/client.py#L190-L191
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v2_0/client.py#L146-L147

Change-Id: Ib9d766a345b68b3920121d8b8c69c4f3c5ca1dc2

commit_message:
Correct VERSION of NetworkRequest

The VERSION of the nova.objects.NetworkRequest object was incorrectly
still at 1.0, even though a 1.1 version had been incremented previously
that added a pci_request_id field to the object.  According to Dan on
IRC, there's no danger here, but this is good to clean up regardless.

From Dan: "the only case where you'd have an issue is if you had a
conductor with the changeset before pci_request was added, and a compute
running the code after"

Cherry-picked from:
cf3c1d10b10067cab226bf9a82e89017a4b27fec

Change-Id: I3d8c1ac22fb50f25cee03bb230fccad2b18deaf5
Closes-bug: #1378461

This module has been named by mistake in openstack-common.conf but has
never been used, except by the RPC code back then. Let's remove it.

subject: Metadef schema column name is a reserved word in MySQL
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 19:05:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Metadef schema column name is a reserved word in MySQL

The metadef_properties and metadef_objects tables both have
a column named schema. Unfortunately, schema is a reserved word
in some relational database products, including MySQL and PostgreSQL.
The metadef_properties.schema and metadef_objects.schema

commit_message:
Metadef schema column name is a reserved word in MySQL

The metadef_properties and metadef_objects tables both have
a column named schema. Unfortunately, schema is a reserved word
in some relational database products, including MySQL and PostgreSQL.
The metadef_properties.schema and metadef_objects.schema
columns should be renamed to a non reserved word.

Conflicts:
	glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadata.py
	glance/tests/unit/test_migrations.py

Change-Id: I9c1b497d2b09b9282a83bd8c19c32edfa4dd159f
Closes-Bug: 1378968

subject: nova service-update returns 500 on child cell
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1011, 'name': 'Tushar Patil', 'email': 'tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com', 'username': 'tpatil'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10795, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'tailor.rajesh88@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajeshtailor'}, {'_account_id': 12548, 'name': 'Dheeraj Gupta', 'email': 'dheeraj.gupta4@gmail.com', 'username': 'dgupta'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-03 16:01:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/manager.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_messaging.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_manager.py', 'nova/cells/messaging.py'], 'message': "nova service-update returns 500 on child cell

When you try to disable/enable the service on child cell in
cell environment, it returns:
ERROR (ClientException): Unknown Error (HTTP 500).

In nova-api log, it throws the following error:
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'region!child@5'

In this case, when call reaches to manager service_update api, there
cells_utils.add_cell_to_service method concatenate the cell_name
(eg. 'region!child') with service_id (eg. 5), and update service['id']
value to 'region!child@5'. Hence it gives the above error.

The actual service enable/disable gets processed correctly.

To resolve this issue, removing the call to add_cell_to_service
method of cells_utils module in service_update api.

When you try to disable/enable the service on non-child (top) cell
in cell environment, it throws following error:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'count'.

In case of parent cell, the self.host_api attribute of
_BaseMessageMethods class points to 'nova.compute.cells_api.HostAPI'.

It calls host_api service_update method after reaching on destination
host (target cell), which again calls the cells_rpcapi service_update
method, when target cell is parent cell itself.
This time cell_name attribute is None after splitting the service_id
while processing the request on target cell, that's why it was
throwing the AttributeError.

To resolve the disable/enable service issue in non-child (top) cell,
calling objects.Service api in _TargetedMessageMethods class
service_update method instead of host_api service_update method.

Change-Id: I8e2530fcde41ac08e6bcd20f5cbbeed5b77d82ce
Closes-Bug: #1361180
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
nova service-update returns 500 on child cell

When you try to disable/enable the service on child cell in
cell environment, it returns:
ERROR (ClientException): Unknown Error (HTTP 500).

In nova-api log, it throws the following error:
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'region!child@5'

In this case, when call reaches to manager service_update api, there
cells_utils.add_cell_to_service method concatenate the cell_name
(eg. 'region!child') with service_id (eg. 5), and update service['id']
value to 'region!child@5'. Hence it gives the above error.

The actual service enable/disable gets processed correctly.

To resolve this issue, removing the call to add_cell_to_service
method of cells_utils module in service_update api.

When you try to disable/enable the service on non-child (top) cell
in cell environment, it throws following error:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'count'.

In case of parent cell, the self.host_api attribute of
_BaseMessageMethods class points to 'nova.compute.cells_api.HostAPI'.

It calls host_api service_update method after reaching on destination
host (target cell), which again calls the cells_rpcapi service_update
method, when target cell is parent cell itself.
This time cell_name attribute is None after splitting the service_id
while processing the request on target cell, that's why it was
throwing the AttributeError.

To resolve the disable/enable service issue in non-child (top) cell,
calling objects.Service api in _TargetedMessageMethods class
service_update method instead of host_api service_update method.

Change-Id: I8e2530fcde41ac08e6bcd20f5cbbeed5b77d82ce
Closes-Bug: #1361180

commit_message:
nova service-delete fails on non-child (top) cell

When you try to delete the service on non-child (api) cell in
cell environment, it throws the error:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'count'.

In case of child cell service-delete it works, because the
self.host_api attribute of _BaseMessageMethods class points to
'nova.compute.api.HostAPI', but in case of parent cell, the
same attribute points to 'nova.compute.cells_api.HostAPI'.
This is the reason it fails when parent cell is the target cell.

It calls host_api service_delete method after reaching on
destination host (target cell), which again calls the cells_rpcapi
service_delete method, when target cell is parent cell itself.
This time cell_name attribute is None after splitting the service_id
while processing the request on target cell, that's why it was
throwing the above error.

To resolve this issue, calling destroy method of objects.Service
class in _TargetedMessageMethods class service_delete method
instead of calling host_api service_delete method.

Change-Id: I103d7a23b38c49a66e50717a52b383922e4b5254
Closes-Bug: #1361186

For resources like ResourceGroup, the output parameters are not
validated during stack creation. When a stack has an output parameter
which accesses an incorrect attribute of a resource, the output-show
command returns the string 'null'.
This fix instead returns an error indicating the incorrect attribute

Closes-bug: #1368041

commit_message:
Fixed null str returned for incorrect parameter

For resources like ResourceGroup, the output parameters are not
validated during stack creation. When a stack has an output parameter
which accesses an incorrect attribute of a resource, the output-show
command returns the string 'null'.
This fix instead returns an error indicating the incorrect attribute
being accessed.

Change-Id: I51eea4738bfefb35644a384ec6d4e9176c8f2e26
Closes-bug: #1368041

This patch adds the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator
to _instance_update(), which has been observed to be
involved in some deadlock scenarios.  As it is the point
of transaction demarcation based on the presence of
get_session(), this is an appropriate point at which the
transaction can be re-attempted in the case of deadlock.

Change-Id: Id2cfdc129ea3cfc787b73f1f3e9aa286a7c0229a
Closes-bug: 1375467
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add @_retry_on_deadlock to _instance_update()

This patch adds the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator
to _instance_update(), which has been observed to be
involved in some deadlock scenarios.  As it is the point
of transaction demarcation based on the presence of
get_session(), this is an appropriate point at which the
transaction can be re-attempted in the case of deadlock.

Change-Id: Id2cfdc129ea3cfc787b73f1f3e9aa286a7c0229a
Closes-bug: 1375467

commit_message:
Whitelist binary 'rm' in tox.ini

To solve the following issue when running 'tox -e docs' it is necessary
to whitelist the binary 'rm'.

---snip---
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /usr/bin/rm
  env: /home/berendt/development/branches/add_doc8/mistral/.tox/docs
Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?
---snap---

Change-Id: I120f221b64038d86afa6611f0f9634bce7b6fc0e

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 11:46:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Removing saving raw action/workflow result under 'task.taskName'

* If we always save raw task result under in the DB it causes problems
  if we, for example, have a huge raw result but don't need it all. We
  may just want to extract somethig from it like number of list items
  etc. E.g. array containing information about 30 VMs takes 130kb space
  and doesn't even fit  MySQL default text type.

  So if we need to save the entire raw result we can easily do that
  using:

    publish:
      full_result: $

  Or using any other key.

  This patch makes accessible the same variables defined in 'publish'
  via context key 'task.taskName'

Change-Id: I81af8496156afb3db46c016019880d84c12917ba

commit_message:
Removing saving raw action/workflow result under 'task.taskName'

* If we always save raw task result under in the DB it causes problems
  if we, for example, have a huge raw result but don't need it all. We
  may just want to extract somethig from it like number of list items
  etc. E.g. array containing information about 30 VMs takes 130kb space
  and doesn't even fit  MySQL default text type.

  So if we need to save the entire raw result we can easily do that
  using:

    publish:
      full_result: $

  Or using any other key.

  This patch makes accessible the same variables defined in 'publish'
  via context key 'task.taskName'

Change-Id: I81af8496156afb3db46c016019880d84c12917ba

commit_message:
Add database relationship between router and ports

Add an explicit schema relationship between a router and its ports. This
change ensures referential integrity among the entities and prevents orphaned
ports.

Change-Id: I09e8a694cdff7f64a642a39b45cbd12422132806
Closes-Bug: #1378866

commit_message:
Leverage openstack.common.importutils for import_class

This patch removes the import_utils method from utils and leverages
the one in novaclient.openstack.common.importutils instead.

Change-Id: I7f27e6abe0a98fb4c71458fc9e5fc38b1af06050
Closes-bug: 1365275

commit_message:
Adds instructions for deploying instances on real hardware

The following sections have been added to the install-guide:

1. Set of instructions for configuring Neutron to talk to baremetal.
   Flat networking is taken as the usecase. Instructions for using
   other types of networks will be added eventually.
2. Set of instructions for adding the required images to glance.
   Includes instructions for creating the deploy and user images
   using disk-image builder.
3. Set of instructions for creating the baremetal flavor and
   associating the deploy images to the flavor.
4. Instruction for checking that the ipmitool on the openstack setup
   is able to control baremetal's power state.

Change-Id: If45f0f32808308cf2d451a905ca7cd840c81c7d2
Partial-Bug: 1323589

commit_message:
Add install guide for users and clean up README

* Add "Using Horizon" section to the docs, which describes
  how to install and configure Horizon. It is for operators
  who install Horizon from source code.
* Clean up README.rst as much of the information is out-of-date
  and most of it is covered by the developer docs.
* Minor update of page titles.

Change-Id: I09aab0d0bc47e07c8d663e7f7b5801e456434950

commit_message:
Correct slo middleware position swift proxy-server pipeline

The recommended position for SLO middleware has changed
in Swift (see change ID I7827dd2d9dfbb3c6424773fb2891355d47e372ba).
This change updates the swift proxy-server pipeline to move SLO
middleware to the correct position.

Related-Bug: #1315133
Change-Id: If52935ec7986adec67bb190a4509c8a8c35056c9

commit_message:
Move install bin from rpm-distro to yum

rpm-distro element was trying to install bin programs into the
image but it doesn't provide any. Move that logic into the yum
element which provides the install-packages bin.

Change-Id: Id5339fc7ffbef6327fe41f50a3e39ab30b6d0320

commit_message:
Update references to auth_token middleware

There's references to the auth_token middleware in keystoncelient.
The auth_token middleware has been moved to keystonemiddleware and
the version in keystoneclient shouldn't be used anymore.

If these references aren't updated, then when options are changed in
keystonemiddleware.auth_token the heat-api will fail to start because
there's duplicate options in keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token.

Change-Id: I04573aa5ff967afe3e00329f797fcc71b779e7b3
Closes-Bug: #1379082

commit_message:
Create Nova Scheduler IO Ops Weighter

Add a new nova scheduler weighter, sort the filter
hosts according to host io ops number, aims to
booting instances on light workload hosts.

blueprint io-ops-weight
Previously-approved: juno

Change-Id: Id283446718fe8390035fbff8c3a73b28f469ecc6

commit_message:
Skip IPv6 Tests in the OpenContrail plugin

Similar to the way we are skipping tests in the OneConvergence plugin,
introduced by Kevin Benton in 9294de441e684a81f6e802ba0564083f1ad319d6.

Partial-Bug: #1378952

Change-Id: I1650b0708af73ce63e92c55bc842607bb69efe60
(cherry picked from commit 67962943969bc737a3f680a0defc2fc9df03c429)

commit_message:
Rename package murano-api to murano

Added backward compatibility logic to murano
to enable Icehouse deployment, but depends on
setting openstack_version to 2014.1.X-6.0

blueprint fuel-deploy-juno

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Borodaenko <dborodaenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I5b7f314c3e9ff8fd34c4e2a7044e282b55ee6b7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 07:11:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Disable PUT for IPv6 subnet attributes

In Juno we are not ready for allowing the IPv6 attributes on a subnet
to be updated after the subnet is created, because:
- The implementation for supporting updates is incomplete.
- Perceived lack of usefulness, no good use cases known yet.
- Allowing updates causes more complexity in the code.
- Have not tested that radvd, dhcp, etc. behave OK after update.

Therefore, for now, we set 'allow_put' to False for the two IPv6
attributes, ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode. This prevents the
modes from being updated via the PUT:subnets API.

Closes-bug: #1378952

Change-Id: Id6ce894d223c91421b62f82d266cfc15fa63ed0e
(cherry picked from commit 8a08a3cb47d0dd69d4aa2e8fa661d04054fe95ae)
